III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is complying will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is complying will all additional DHHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not in need of technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility was not required to submit any acceptable corrective action plans during
this licensing period.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
This report outlines the unplanned removals from the facility over the past reporting
period. This involved two youth who went AWOL and did not return. One of the other
youth was hospitalized and the fourth youth was placed in a juvenile detention center.
The Chief Administrator identified the need to improve their compliance with rule 4126
by implementing a more rigorous interviewing process. Staff will be trained in de-
escalation techniques with a focus on the steps to verbally deescalate. This training
which is already occurring will be intensified. A competency test will be required of all
staff competing the training. The facility will also only accept youth who are able to
function in a community setting. To ensure this is occurring, the admission team will
speak with the youth’s pervious placement to gather all relative information. Prior to
discharge, the facility will require weekly updates regarding leads on community
placement. This is to occur with input from the youth.
Interviews:
Interviews took place with the three youth currently in the program and with staff who
were present at the time of the inspection. The youth report feeling safe at the facility
and having a belief the facility is supportive and helpful. All three youth are in the
4

process of preparing for discharge to different settings and they voiced the help and
guidance the facility is providing for this upcoming planned change. Staff reported a
strong desire to support youth and believe administration is supportive of them. The
administration reported considering a change in programing once the last of the three
youth are discharged. The only change will be moving from female youth to male
youth.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
